HomePage.welcomeTitle: Welcome to the Drug and Disease Knowledge Graph!
HomePage.welcomeDescription: The Drug and Disease Knowledge Graph is a tool that visualizes the relationships between drugs, diseases, biological processes, and genes in 3D.
HomePage.datasetInfo: The Dataset, with 197,303 nodes and 6,183,329 relations (triplets).
HomePage.visualizationDescription: Dive into dynamic, interactive 3D visualizations that bring drug and disease relationships to life, enabling better data exploration and insights.
HomePage.interfaceDescription: The user-friendly interface lets you filter data, customize views, and interact with the graph for an intuitive research experience.
HomePage.databaseDescription: Powered by over 190,000 nodes and 6 million relationships, integrating data from a range of reputable biomedical databases like DrugBank, Gene Ontology, and more.
HomePage.repurposingDescription: Leveraging the RotatE algorithm, the project explores potential drug repurposing opportunities, making it easier to discover new therapeutic uses for existing drugs.

ContactsPage.title: Contacts
ContactsPage.faculty: School of Computer Science and Technology
